sources.title: Nevada Office of the Labor Commissioner

nonCompete.detailedExplanation: Nevada restricts non-competes: (1) employee must be provided consideration (salary/benefit) beyond continued employment, (2) cannot exceed 1 year for non-supervisory/non-executive employees earning less than statutory threshold, (3) must be reasonable in scope and necessary to protect legitimate business interest.
nonCompete.suggestion: Provide additional consideration, limit to 1 year for lower-earning employees
nonCompete.actionRequired: Ensure statutory requirements met: consideration provided, 1-year limit for non-executives under threshold
nonCompete.alternativeLanguage: non-compete restrictions per Nevada NRS § 613.195 (with consideration and time limits)

salaryHistory.message: CANNOT seek salary history before making compensation offer
salaryHistory.detailedExplanation: Employers cannot seek wage or salary history from prospective employees. Can discuss salary expectations. After making offer, can confirm salary history.
salaryHistory.actionRequired: Remove salary history questions from pre-offer process
salaryHistory.alternativeLanguage: What are your salary expectations for this position?

backgroundChecks.message: Cannot require disclosure of criminal history on initial application
backgroundChecks.detailedExplanation: Cannot inquire about criminal history on initial employment application. Can inquire after determining applicant meets minimum qualifications.
backgroundChecks.requirement: Remove criminal history from initial applications

minimumWage.detailedExplanation: Nevada minimum wage is $12.00/hour regardless of health benefits offered (effective July 1, 2024). Adjusted annually based on CPI.

paidLeave.message: NO state-mandated paid sick leave currently
paidLeave.detailedExplanation: Some local ordinances (e.g., certain Nevada counties) may have requirements

drugScreening.message: Cannot refuse to hire based on positive marijuana test
drugScreening.detailedExplanation: Nevada prohibits refusing to hire prospective employees solely based on positive marijuana screening test. Exceptions for certain safety-sensitive positions and federal contractors.
drugScreening.requirement: Cannot disqualify solely for marijuana-positive test
drugScreening.actionRequired: Review drug testing policies for marijuana provisions

finalPay.message: Final wages due within 3 days (discharge) or next payday (resignation)
finalPay.detailedExplanation: Discharge: within 3 days. Resignation with 7+ days notice: next payday. Resignation without notice: next payday or 7 days, whichever is earlier.

rightToWork.message: Nevada is RIGHT TO WORK state

dailyOvertime.message: Daily overtime required for 8+ hour shifts
dailyOvertime.detailedExplanation: Overtime pay (1.5x) required for: (1) work over 40 hours per week, OR (2) work over 8 hours in a 24-hour period (if agreed rate less than 1.5x regular rate).
dailyOvertime.requirement: Pay overtime for 8+ hour days in addition to 40+ hour weeks
dailyOvertime.actionRequired: Ensure daily overtime tracking and payment
